snippet: The insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of President Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.
abstract: Obama administration officials are preparing to set up and operate new health insurance markets in about half the states, where local officials appear unwilling or unable to do so; insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of Pres Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.
lead_paragraph: The insurance marketplaces are a centerpiece of President Obama’s health care law, but federal officials never expected to have to run them themselves.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Brace for Huge Task of Operating Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Brace for Huge Task Of Operating Health Exchanges

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
